alert.note: Alert for Hunt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 23 at 8:16AM CST until January 25 at 1:50AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville affecting Hunt County. South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan affecting Rockwall and Hunt Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cowleech Fork Sabine River at Greenville. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor out of bank flooding will occur along the river reach. Caution should be exercised near the river as water flows out of banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 16.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
